data.text: Protects my privacy while browsing, and now has an app privacy protection feature that stops apps from sharing my personal information. Well done! It's worked well for me for years. However, recently it's started taking longer to load pages and I'm at times getting messages that the browser can't open a webpage. It's not my wifi as Chrome does not have the same problems. Hopefully this will be fixed in an update soon.

This is by far The Best Browser I have used on my Android device. I no longer get all of those irritating, unwanted ads that cover content and don't have a close button! I would like to be able to use voice searches on this browser that are not on my menu, like Google. I am researching how to resolve this not included feature. So, I must use the Google Voice Search that I Do Not like temporarily, unfortunately. Nonetheless, I highly recommend this browser. It gives me more freedom. No ad wars!

üòê The DuckDuckGo app is: mostly improved lately. [My Favorites bookmarks suddenly disappeared. Multiple detailed reports submitted and AFTER MONTHS, no response. Many web pages just won't work; FEEDBACK REPORTS IGNORED (The app crashes multiple times per day; Audio streams repeatedly stop only seconds after initiating the play/'playback'; It's useless for things such as audio, and others; I've had to return to using other browsers for certain things.)] Beta App Tracker Protection is a big plus.
data.replyText: Thank you for sharing that feedback; we're sorry to hear you're running into that issue on your device, but we appreciate you taking the time to help us improve.

data.text: VPN was easily turned off when I set the option for never disconnect, but this is about the fourth or fifth time, I guess if you don't buy the VPN what can you expect, just a heads up people. And when I sent a message I had to send another before I got a call back at which time some new disclaimer stated that was possible if I was utilizing certain applications , the funny part I was looking at the phone that Was about 2' away and watched it happen, it didn't have anything to do with me!!!

I would give this at 5 stars, except certain tabs just disappear out of nowhere. The back and forward commands don't work appropriately, sometimes when you go back it takes away the option for you to go forward. If you hit back it may even take you to a whole other tab, changing the previous tab creating a situation where you can't find where you just work. Browser history saves nothing, this app was great but it seems kind of buggy now.

The only downside is that it is slightly slower than Brave. I have used it for years. The feature to clear/clean the app when you are finished is incredibly helpful. Arguably you do have more privacy on Brave, I believe duckduckgo uses the same basic architecture as chrome with added blocking technology. It's certainly effective at reducing adds for the stuff that you search for.

Until I use it a little longer, get used to it more, I will refrain from 5 stars. Edit after considerable use and experience. I like it a lot, however, in you tube (yes, I know that is still controlled by Google, bit I will get a sudden white screen in the midstof watching a video, I have to raise the screen a bit, hit the 3 veritcal bars, get back into DDG and then hopefully get the video back, but 75% of the time I have to search for it, then maybe I find the video I was at before the wipeout

Blocks AMP Sites, is that good? Sure, but the problem is that it never transitions the site to the real website. So I click an AMP url and I'm taken to a black screen that never loads. I have to find the "amp" tag in the url to remove it and refresh. Unfortunately I click amp links enough this is forcing me to switch browsers. Update: haven't had issues with AMP sites for a little bit, but now I'm having trouble with some UI elements not working on some websites.

Getting better all the time . Fast, small footprint. best in class. I can't tell if it's using the Google DNS or the private custom DNS that I entered. Pop ups and redirects are still not completely handled. I can't tell if the VPN function is working or adequate. With the VPN connected in all the time mode even when not browsing or streaming my battery usage goes way up. strange.

I especially love being able to shop for travel arrangements without the airlines, car rental companies and hotels jacking up the rates if I can't finish it all in one go and have to come back several times to complete my plans! They simply CANNOT TRACK YOU . (at least so far.. hope it stays that way.

I really appreciate that the browser gives a variety of responses to searches and does a good job of blocking trackers and things I dont want. Once installed I noticed a reduction in email clutter. The occasional downside is it won't work well with many things that aren't set up for it for whatever reason - maybe the developer simply doesn't want to spend the time. I find the same issue to a lessor degree with Firefox, but there are times when only Chrome will work.

Great app, so far. Every issue seems to be corrected, best Browser app I have ever used, recommend every one to try it. The Key Pad Options are awesome. The Browser lets you feel more comfortable surfing the Web knowing it's keeping you safe. Thank You! 02-01-2024 after last update, notification bubble shows on duckduckgo app all the time, can not clear. Was fine before last update. There is another app that has the same issue, can't get that issue fixed unless I turn the notifications bubble of

Great tracking protection across apps. Doesn't work with password manager (Norton in particular, I haven't tested others) so I have to manually look up and enter login credentials. Tracking protection is a GREAT feature - it blocks tracking attempts and keeps track of what was blocked. If it causes an app to not work, it's easy to disable for individual apps, and easy to report, and reported issues apparently get fixed pretty quickly.

Keeps my information private. I think DuckDuckGo provides more protection and privacy than Mozilla. I have been using this for over a year and so far very happy. I have had occasional display issues on some websites. But if that happens, I would use Google for those sites. So far, less than two sites had issues. A little slow to load the initial page but it is fast afterwards. I think I can depend on DuckDuckGo to protect my privacy without having to install all kinds of other software!

So far, the DDGo Private Browser works very well. I have made it my default instead of Chrome, but there are issues. When "clicking" on an internet link, a new window is opened each time. You can't just go back to the prior page. If migrating from a link inside an email, closing that page doesn't take you back to the email. Eventually, if you're not careful, you end up with many DDG windows, making it a memory hog.

The cookie management is nice and the tab navigation is pretty smooth. It does some weird resets on tabs that sit "idle" sometimes though and that can be annoying but is probably better for privacy. But To really be protective, though, it needs better ad blocking and pop up blocking. The focus on privacy to the exclusion of other protections made this overall a sub-par browsing experience. It's like going backwards to a time when every page could just bombard you with garbage.

Love its ability to block perpetrators using my installed apps to get in to my phone. There were 2x that tracking protection stopped, but regular search engine no problem. The 2 times it stopped I was alerted immediately so I could turn it back on with a simple slide button. Very happy with this software. It has blocked thousands of attempts and when you see how many and where they come from it's staggering. This rating is for my cell phone, although I do have DDG on my desktop as well. Thanks

If you have the app open but need to do a quick check in another app. When you go back to duckduckgo, it automatically reloads the page you were on and erases anything you were working on on the website you are working in. Also, there is no way to close all open tabs at once. Search results aren't good and doesn't give you direct results. It wastes more time than it is worth.

I love DuckDuchGo! Since I began using it, I have been continually impressed by its many facets and services, which over the years (&, though I'm sure I could trace the specifics back by exploring my emails and archives, I have really no idea how long that has been! Probably from close to when it was put on the market ‚Äî but have, really, no idea.

I absolutely love this freaking app!! I can't believe I never used it before! I've been getting really upset lately that my phone is tracking and/or spying on me and I was right! DuckDuckGo is now totally saving me and my stress level is going down now. I also enjoy seeing the total amount of trackers it blocks each time I get on my phone. I will always tell everyone about it.

I never have any problem with this browser and I feel really great that I'm not being tracked.. for a lot of reasons that are unimportant right now I was forced into buying a Google pixel 8 phone which I will soon get rid of but that thing tracks everything you do. I put DuckDuckGo on this pixel 8, so I can have some privacy. Thank you DuckDuckGo!

This app is excellent fo security and safety while browsing the internet. I have noticed, however that is sometimes gets stuck on verifying a website and will reload over and over attempting to verify said website but is unable to complete the process. I'm currently using the app on a chromebook so that may have something to do with it, but I've used it on a regular laptop with no issues. All in all a good app to have and use daily for information security, but it stil has minor issues.

I have used DuckDuckGo intermittently for quite some time. I find that it is considerably more objective than Google and the kinds of searches that I do. One shortcoming is lack of voice to text in the browsing process. I think that would be a relatively easy fix. JC

Very speedy browser compared to others I've tried but still not complete in terms of features. Please integrate ad blocking for the browser, add dark mode for websites, other browsers can do this, you can too... Add the ability to move the browser UI to the bottom not just the top.. I certainly like how speedy things load and how it works on my pixel, further improvements and features to compete with the other top browsers is needed though...

Terribly sorry I'm getting this all out, but please fix DDG for my device! Ever since its last update, it's been the slowest, freeziest piece of cow manure I've ever had on here! But I'm sort of stuck with it because I can't find any other decent browsers. If this isn't fixed, we might just have to rename this browser "DuckDuckSlow." Very frustrating.

I love it, no virus, no crashes, and love the privacy it provides. Since I am using Duck my computer never crashed or my cell. I do not have to restart it or set it up over and over. Google is not good, crashes and wants to control my cell, my Ipod, and my life. Show me how to add the Search bar and remove the assistant that shows when I open DuckDuck ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

(Feb02-2024) Seems to have changed. Some pages when loading, often show load bar stopping halfway showing no webpage. Using Fire button leaves DuckGo browser rendered inoperable & prevents using Android bottom back button, min/max buttons. Not always that way, but when it starts it's stuborn. Cant find clesr cache option settings menu. (11-19-23)Informative tools and easy to use, reassuring and flexable.

Great app and really does work, also love the amail protector they have, sometimes works a little too well, I've had jobs not be able to email me because of the filter. lol but it does help cut down on the spam, also tells you every last company trying to obtain your personal information, its daunting see the list of companies they've blocked, countless.

The best overall privacy tool for its simplicity and the number of functions it fulfills. One does not need to be tech-savvy either for it to fulfill these functions and its interface is superb. Browser wise it's like a chromium version of Firefox Focus which I also use and love, but with some tweaks that make it unique and much simpler settings to navigate for the non tech-savvy.

I'd give it 5 but seems something in the settings messes with the bluetooth on my tablet & makes it sound crummy. Drives me nuts tryong to isolate it so i still use chrome for earbuds. Otherwise really truly great (!!!!) for what it does privacy-wise, but also search results could still be a lill better. Just what it shows me about certain sites (let alone what it blocks!) makes it a necessity regardless, even if I never used the search engine,which is actually the default on most of my devices.

‚ù§Ô∏è the app. I appreciate the ability to protect my privacy, unlike others where they follow your everywhere &, w/out opt-out option, they will share all kinds of things "based on your searches or info". Would be great if there was an option to merge tabs into groups, & also the ability to name the groups. While DuckDuckGo offers dark mode, I would like it for all pgs. I would like the ability that when I "go back", it goes to where I was (while removing the pg I was on).

It's not the most convenient web browser but it does block most ads. I can surf websites that were near unmanageable before. It feels like a permanent incognito mode. It's like a lack of retention which is probably from blocking cookies as well. Gotta sign back into things a lot if you tab out and started making use of bookmarks a lot more because of it.

Overall the app works as well or better than any browser I have used in the past. Since the 11/13/23 update I have been getting pop up sticky videos on some of the web sites I visit. I have used these sites for many years without stickies so what has changed. DDG has always stopped all pop up and unwanted adds from interfering with my browsing, something has changed. The sticky adds have stopped and everything has been back to great the past 2 months. Thank you DDG.

So far I enjoy not being bombarded by ads. It needs a home button like Google. I'm tired of having to open a new tab or start a new search from a previous site. Being able to look at recipes without my phone basically shutting down from ads makes up for it in a way. Overall it needs a little updating and modernization.

Does what it says on the tin. Brilliantly fast browser but still doesn't (seem to) have the ability to block everything ad wise like it should. Trackers? Brilliant at that. There needs to be a button to turn the browsers VPN off at times (like connecting to a router to install security devices, etc), and that should he done now rather than later. Currently, the only way to get around that is to uninstall Duck, install the devices, and reinstall Duck. Surely this isn't by design, right????

Versatile, quick loading and stable search engine. The development group strives for keeping private your browsing and related info. Results are streamlined and not limited by algoritms based on previous history (like most of other main stream browsers). Categorizes sites by privacy levels offered and has max one ad at the top of the results found. Absolutely competitive vs any other browser. Try it for yourself and see üëà I also love the latest version with the tracker blocker simulating a VPN

Would give it more, but it doesn't give me the full version. I can't monitor who's tracking me even though it advertises this feature. Is not compatible with my premium security app. Feb. 11, 2024. Update my review. 5 stars all the way ‚ú®Ô∏è. The app tracking feature is a must. Was shocked to learn how many apps were trying to obtain my personal info. Everything from phone numbers to D.O.B. to contacts. Duck Duck Go blocks üö´ them all no matter how relentless they are. My go-to browser.

It's a beautiful browser. Big tech oligarchs may not like it but I do:) I used the Windows version- it's still under development, it's buggy. The browser kept crashing while I was filling out detailed forms online, so that was frustrating. When a stable version is released, I'll try it again.

App tracking protection on version 5.183.0 stops immediately on a LineageOS 16/Android 9 device. This has happened since an update around the end of May 2023; uninstalling and reinstalling or clearing storage does not resolve the problem. It runs without problems on several other devices, including LineageOS/Android 7.1.2. I hope you eventually fix the halt; it is a very nice feature, and I use it on every other device.

I truly love this app! It provides a relief knowing that it stops the unwanted ads, pop-ups, and etc. It gives a great feeling of of enjoyment to explore the many incredible people, places, and things that are out there to learn more about. I really is great! I would and will recommend it to my family and friends. I say "give it a try and see what it does for you".

Worked great for a while, then started not loading websites, freezing, and not functioning in general. I don't know if I did something wrong, developer may not have accounted for a user that forgot to close the tabs for several days. I've tried everything short of clearing the data (I have cleared the cache) and uninstalling.

Good overall. But weird things happen when you leave tabs open and close the app or turn off your phone. Upon reopening it does load the tab but for some of the tabs, especially the first tab, it refuses to subsequently reload it and seems to lose the url even though it's right there. If you then hit the back button it just displays an empty tab and you have lost the url and page.

I don't know what you did in the latest update but now the biggest picture on the webpage is dictating the size of everything else. If it's a big picture everything else around it is small. If I want to read anything I have to zoom in. When I do that I have to scroll side-to-side to read the entire line. Increasing the size of the font in the accessibility settings does nothing. Please fix.

I've been using this app for several months now. I love how it tells you which apps are trying to track you and how many times they do within an hour. I'm so thankful for all of the trackers this app blocks! It helps me know which apps I should uninstall due to privacy concerns. However, when you search within the browser, the results aren't great and sometimes they're totally irrelevant. Regardless, I've switched to using DuckDuckGo on every device I own. I feel more secure knowing I have it.

Quite new to the app but I like that it gives a warning for any sites that may keep your information. Other than that, I don't see much difference between this and Google. So if I can have a thorough search, with the same results, I'm going to choose the engine that doesn't keep my history. Updated to add that since I started using a Duck email address (it just filters email into your existing email) I have almost NO SPAM!!! That is Wonderful ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

This is my second time around. Android literally deleted it and all the apps tied to it just a while ago in an "update" it made me mad because one of the many apps that disappeared was my med chart and I had several appointments coming up in days. It is important to have a safe place to explore the web. My only complaint is I can't use voice to text on this app and being low vision that is important to me.

Thanks for trying to address bookmark issue. However, the update rearranged all the bookmarks in a "by default" way. Folders should be grouped together! Since rearrangement, now I have to find a folder and then either Drag it up through HUNDREDS of single bookmarks or edit the folder and move it to a new location... But now that all of the bookmarks were rearranged with the update, the file tree of EVERYTHING is all disorganized. Please add better auto sorting, a slidebar, and group the folders!

Hey is there any way you could bill me I want to contribute but with my banking system it's costly to send money. So if you send a bill for zero dollars. An edit pen button that allows the recipient to pay whatever they like then it will have no charge for it. Also would allow anyone who set up a monthly amount on auto pay. Just saying it you make it easy, it will come to you.

I love the app better than chrome. I wish that when I burn the tab/all tabs that it would at least ask me if I wanted to close the app and return to my home screen or restart the browser instead of just oping a new tab. Also it would be nice to see if there's a way to just use 1 tab instead of opening a new one every time I close out then open the app again.

This is my 2nd time opening DDG, the more I use it, the more comfortable I'll be in rating it. I'm glad it does what it does tracking trackers and disabling bad stuff. It's like security without the badge. Norton is too aggressive. If DDG is watching,or following bare with me while I continue to gain Intel. I'm noticing as I go what your site does. The more I notice, the more I ll rate.

I've been a new user for a week! Browsing the web and knowing that you are protected from threats of compromising your privacy is a win. Usually, with alternatives, you experience slow connection and uploads of sites, so I was surprised by the functionality of this browser. As another layer of protection, this browser allows you an alias email name that routes any email to your primary mailbox of your choice. What are you waiting for? DuckDuckGo Download the app already!

Overall pretty satisfied. Wished there was an option to disallow video autoplay. Also, it seems when the browser encounters a DNS or network or SSL error, etc, the tab that it occurred within won't "recover" from the error (whether I manually go to another website, disconnect and reconnect to the network, etc) I must open a new tab and resume whetever I was doing. Also, the browser seems to hide such errors from the user, particularly SSL errors (as an I.T. guy I WANT to see such errors)

Oh I've been waiting for this day. The day we start to get our PRIVACY back. This little browser is cool as f***. DuckDuckGo is on our side. When you look at the number of trackers that it blocks everyday its sickening. The browser feels lighter, moves, faster and after using it for a couple of days I started getting a sense o relief that I'm not being spid on so much. We got a long way to go to get PRIVACY back but this browser is a strong step in the right direction.

I can perform searches without getting streams of ads. Before when I mistakenly landed on an adult website, though I exited without scrolling, I got streams of unwanted ads and sites that i sent to spam. I have a new phone and am starting with duckduckgo as my browser. Problem solved so far. There was virtually no learning curve; it is easy and fast.

Please stop including results for things I didn't search for. I promise that if I want to search for "how to apply ktape," then that's what I would type. You don't need to add multiple words that aren't in my search, and I shouldn't have to put quotes on every word in my search just to avoid having random things thrown in with the results. Having each individual word quotes seems to impact my results as well.

No way to sort bookmark folders. Seems to me a long-press and drag to new location would be any easy fix. Don't care for the drop-down menu layout. Too easy to tap the wrong button. I keep bookmarked in folders. It would be nice if the folder I'm using would stay as the focus folder next time I go to bookmarks.

EDIT: I use an older version of the app. I haven't downloaded updates for over a year because each one is worse than the last according to reviews. I've been using the app for at least 3 years now. I feel like my privacy is much more secure than when I use other browsers. A reviewer complained about the windows/tabs not closing out closing the app. Personally, I LOVE that I can be researching something, have several windows open, and they are still there when I come back and re-open the app.

Updated - 3 years later, it's the only web browser I use. It's taken a lot of understanding and getting used to, but with the updates they made, I'm satisfied with it. Great job! Really tested this app to see its capabilities. Good so far with some complaints. It doesn't block pop ups very well. Pop ups get through as another tab opened in the background. I haven't found a setting for that yet.
data.replyText: Thanks for sticking with us! ü¶Ü We had some issues with pop-ups recently that should be fixed in the latest update. If you continue to see pop-ups, you can anonymously report them via the "Report broken site" option and we'll investigate.

data.text: I really enjoy this app! Primarily, I am a staunch supporter of the digital right to privacy, and this browser/app is very accessible. Also, as a recovering tab hoarder, it is especially nice. If the ability to add extensions is ever added, this browser would be perfect. My only issue is that I've had an ongoing (but rare) problem where a popup seems to freeze the app, not allowing scrolling or clicking on links. The only option is to wipe all tabs, which can be immensely frustrating.

It used to save downloaded pictures in /pictures, now it saves them in /downloads, with no apparent way to change it back. Why the change? Why no setting? This is a major inconvenience because now it saves pictures with everything else and I have to sort them out and move them. If you're going to change app behavior make it a user setting. Also the "feedback" link here in the app store provides no way for product feedback beyond the physical address. I guess I'll write you a letter.
data.replyText: Hi Rick, thanks for sharing your feedback! There is an option to share feedback directly with us in settings.

data.text: I only downloaded this app a week ago. It has worked smooth and efficiently, with no issues. When apps and websites function as they should, it's easy not to take notice. That's because it's not imposing itself into the foreground, which allows a more straightforward, focused experience for the end user. Kudos & well done, DDG! John M, Florida

Update: Since the November 2, 2023 update, the app no longer works. When I open it I either see a pure black screen or it closes. DuckDuckGo is my go to browser and I cannot wait until they have a PC version. if it really does what it says it does, not tracking us like the others,then this is an example of what all browsers should be. it can even give you the results that other browsers would have brought up. look it up!
data.replyText: Hi Susanna, sorry to hear about this issue. Have you tried upgrading your app to the latest version? By the way, our web browser for Windows is now available in beta! You can download it here: www.duckduckgo.com/browser

data.text: Definitely liking using this browser and search engine. In a lot of ways I do think it's better than chrome/Google even in terms of features. Only things I miss are when I swipe "back" on my phone I'm used to the tab closing so I don't have to manually close it, and also that convenient ability to swipe down from the address bar and access all the tabs. And the widget could have a thinner option without favorites. But overall I'm happy and I think I'm going to continue to use this browser.
data.replyText: Thanks for the feedback! We've added it to a list of changes to the back button behavior which we've been considering.

data.text: I've been using DDG for years now, and don't miss Chrome or Google search one bit. I especially don't miss all the ads. The Tracker blocking feature (see settings to turn on) works across all apps on your device--not just in the DDG browser. In some ad-supported games, I found that it reduced the entire ad to just an "x" button! The running tally of blocked trackers, including the offending app and the tracking service, is very gratifying. I highly recommend DuckDuckGo.

It's great at blocking ads and popups and protecting my privacy. However. The fact that the virtual keyboard appears whenever the app is launched is really really annoying.. The keyboard then covers the lower third of my favorites. Update: the logo for one of my favorites now shows up on several other favorites, replacing those with its own. In other words, the logo for website "A" is also used for "B", "C" and "D". Blocking ads is great but the subsequent battery drain? Not so much.

I just downloaded this because I recommended it to a friend, So I thought I should try it too. The free VPN is awesome... But, with the key on the right side of the navigation bar. I don't see the need to also have the duck on the left. One icon is enough & I prefer the key & get rid of the duck. I try to keep my drop down as clean as possible. I also noticed your browser works better then Firefox on some sites. Keep up the great work.
data.replyText: Hi Robert, glad you're enjoying our app! We hear your feedback. By the way, our App Tracking Protection feature blocks 3rd-party trackers in your apps, but works differently than a VPN.

data.text: Does anyone read this? Something has been changed. My fonts and text size have shrunk. It's almost illegible. My phone settings are still on largest size but it has been changed somehow to the small size even though it's set to the largest. Please fix the bookmarks. They need to be alphabetized. I think it's the best tracking blocker. But!!!! It needs the ability to sort,or move,or alphabetize the Bookmarks.
data.replyText: Thanks for reporting this. Please update to the newest app version, as we have fixed this issue in the latest release (version 5.181.1)

data.text: Love the privacy protection, which is why I installed it. Some of my browsing seems a bit more likely to time out, but I'm usually working with one bar on mobile service, so that may just be my connection. When I download things, I like the way it just does it. Chrome incognito would always ask permission. My only quibble is I wish it had a secondary screen lock like chrome for when I lock my phone.

What the hell did you guys do? This browser has been working great for the past month, then yesterday it started acting up. Pages just don't load, the load bar gets about halfway then stalls. The app goes unresponsive and I have to do a forced close all recent apps from my phone. Or it freezes and a popup says the app isn't responding, wait, or close app options. Fix it I can't even send you feedback. The link you posted just takes you to the definition of feedback on duckduckgo...
data.replyText: Sorry to hear about this! We're investigating this issue at the moment, if you've noticed specific situations or websites where this always occurs, could you tell us to help us diagnose the issue? You can provide more info in this review, or alternatively email 9iarufe9@duck.com. Thanks!

data.text: it tends to work. other than that, i'd like to know why despite denying it unnecessary permissions under the settings, when checking under all permissions, it denies nothing. it even has access to modifying my system, recording audio and video, running installer programs and all kinds of other fun things i wish it wouldn't. this is what 'pro-privacy' means nowadays i guess.
data.replyText: Hi, thanks for your review. We only ask for the minimum permissions needed for the app to work. There are certain permissions that are only used for App Tracking Protection, and won't be used if that feature isn't turned on. Hope this helps!

data.text: Love the app and the ease of deleting pages in the settings after I close out. And big thanks to the programmers for putting favorites up front without having to search through all of my bookmarks. One thing I do not like (or else I'd have given it five stars): the top suggestions seem to be politically-motivated to show only one side of the story on an issue (censorship through omission.) But, having said that, I know full-well that ALL search engines do that. 4* instead of 5*.

So far I like it! It shows you which sites attempt to track info and the amount of instances thereof, it has a fire button that deletes all the history and data right there by the search bar. üòïüòÜ The best quality is that it works very quickly compared to Google and Chrome that I was using but I gotta see how that holds up after using it more. Its sort of weird not using Google to search and using what would be like the address bar though, but, yeah okay.

Other than not being able to figure out how to get out of incognito mode so I can use my voice to text feature, this service is amazing & I love how I can rely on it for stopping the different things or people spying on me & even lets me know when that occurs & who was trying to spy, yeah absolutely love it!üòÉ Although I wish it was more of an AI personal assistant not just a search engine/browser but there's always room for improvement in all things. But it still deserves five stars!

I like the privacy DDG gives you. Search engine is good but not the best. I love that it imported Chrome bookmarks including folders. I wish I could organize them the way I want. I do not like how the menu always takes you to the default page that you cannot organize. The Folders are at the top which is OK but the starting point when you hit Bookmarks in the menu takes you to the first actual bookmark not the top of the page. I hate that you can't open PDF files and hangs up.

The app is probably the most clean app I've ever seen and trying to search up anything possible using Google. and everything else, the only problem that I'm missing is looking through your history. I think every other browser should have the ability to look into your history and see what website you look at. Otherwise, it's going to be an everyday occurrence, where Every other website, we would need to bookmarket in order to remember it. Other than that, it's a great browser to use

It is a very safe app to use, the only problem is the landscape mode, I don't know why, but it won't allow me to go into landscape mode when watching something. All my other apps work perfectly fine for it, I thought I messed something up within my phone settings, but I have come to find it is the browser itself. Please fix and I will give 5 stars.

I am satisfied with the browser's performance, speed, and its commitment to privacy protection. The enhancements made to the settings, search functionality, and favorites bars are both logical and practical. This alternative browser has exceeded my expectations, particularly in addressing the contemporary risks associated with everyday internet browsing.

Security is wonderful, but I cannot take this app seriously as my primary with bookmark organization THIS bad. All bookmarks go into the outermost level. You can create folders but new bookmarks still drop outside them. I could accept that if there was a group select in the menu. But no, you MUST double back and move everything INDIVIDUALLY. Google goes out of their way to punish you with inconvenience if you turn off monitoring where you can. It's a pity this app does too.

5 stars so far! Love it as an unbiased alternative to Google. I remember using duck duck go 10+ years ago and it was okay but it's so much sleeker. Criticisms: I really wish I could group tabs together (like the chrome app). I also really miss being able to highlight a word and instantly search or see the definition (like the chrome app). Hopefully we see more updates in the future, but for right now I will continue using duck duck go as my primary search engine

Still ignores the parameters of my search. I put in "Paper cartridges parchment" and "Parchment paper cartridges." It only pulled up about cooking with parchment and how parchment paper is made. I've had trouble with the parameters being ignored often before. I've been told that it was being fixed. Now I'm going to look for another SE. I'll still keep this one as well. Mainly because I hope they fix it.

Fantastic search-engine/web-browser!!! There are only a few things missing/needing 2 be added (IMO)! A) Add additional/internal searc capabilities, I.E. after a word/sentence is highlighted, search results should then appear at the bottom of the page, like an additional "mini-tab" that is temporary. B) Make zooming in & out capabilities on EVERY-SINGLE-PAGE C) Photos/images should be capable of downloading, regardless of what the website admin thinks about it! Fix those, & you get 5‚òÜ's from me!!

Please update app on Android 14 One UI 6.0. The app no longer functions correctly on an S22 Ultra while downloading files. It crashes the system and causes the phone lose several functions like volume control and the ability to shut down or restart the phone. I have to force the phone to perform a hard shutdown and reboot potentially losing many of my photos and files. Please fix, the App was working flawlessly before the last Android update on Dec. I'll change my review once it's fixed. Thanks
data.replyText: Thanks for letting us know, we'll look into it!

data.text: I'm changing from 5 to 3 stars. Many sites have stopped working since 11.13 23 update. Prompt appears to allow permission for drm software. But the prompt is incomplete so that user can't allow or deny access. Screen locks up. Chrome works fine. Please fix asap. Support site is useless. Searching help site is useless too. Links for support don't work.

I had to reinstall this app. Now I can't get rid of the repeated notice on the homepage ("Now try visiting one of your favorite sites" blah blah blah). And Favorites icons no longer appear on the homepage (only the aforementioned stupid notice does). Most settings are buried 2 steps under Private Search (not intuitive at all). What happened to this app??

Every update makes it worse. It was excellent over a year sgo, and it' gone down hill since. Most websites I get errors on and or it just won't load correctly. Add blocking really doesn't work as it shoud anymore either. Update November 2023. App was working fine until newest update and now it's constantly freezing, not responding, and unavailable to find a website.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear this. Can you give an update on whether it is still happening?

data.text: Never use anything else for searching & browsing! If you have a concern about all the information and personal data that's being gathered, then Duck Duck Go is your first step to ending it. I haven't seen a Google search bar (yes they can be deleted!) nor opened a chrome browser in years üòÅ *Full* search results that are complete and unmodified by others. Protect yourself from the dozens of apps that are tracking your every move and sending it to only-God-knows-who! The free VPN stops those!

1.) Add Speed Rate Tap ribbon banner of 0.25 and / or a rate of speed scale slider w/ numerical indication of its rate of speed as the user's current choice. 2.) Add a fully functional Mute toggle button accessible from your upcoming browser update. 3.) Make free upgrades available for all your automatic and manual updates. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Best regards, Dave P. S. I highly value your work to date. Well done. There's almost always room for improvement.

DuckDuckGo has been my go-to web browser after I've tried several that were not satisfactory. I think that it has been improved since I wrote my first review. Additional 11/18/ 23. Has a DRM pop-up that cannot be removed except by restarting the phone. Once appears the pop-up will carry over to any other website you want to go to and be an interference in accessing the new site. In my opinion is pop-up is not only an annoyance it may very well be illegal.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear you were affected by the issue. We released a fix on Friday that has made the prompt dismissible.

data.text: Useful browser. Functions as well as any other. I am very pleased with the tracking blocker. Shocked by the frequency and sheer volume of tracking attempts by some apps. Some of it is legitimate back-end process monitoring, but the vast majority is truly invasive and unnecessary. Even on services where you decline all permissions. Honestly, I'm disturbed how much.

Super search engine that has come a long way since I last tried it. I find it gives now the best results compared to other search engines. Simpler presentation of search results, without any of the cluter, no sponsored links, etc... And no tracking. I am now using it as default search engine.

Good but I'd like to block ads from search results. This is now my default browser. Love the "fire" button. I would like to see a separate search bar i.e. not having to type into what, traditionally, is the URL bar. it also needs an ad blocker for Facebook. EDIT: the app tracking blocker is a fantastic add on although quite disconcerting to see how many times apps attempt to track you.

Stellar experience so far, except for one hiccup where I tried opening a website (it was a map for a video game) , but instead of opening it would try to download the image to a Google drive account. I couldn't get out of this screen and had to un-install the app üòí I since reinstalled, but found that pretty inconvenient. Other than that one issue, it's been stellar! I've recommended the app to friends and family.

Going OK so far, I'm missing saved tiles for websites I like to keep for later browsing, it doesn't save them atm. Changed my stars to 5 found it, it is the number 10 icon, all old pages stored there. ü•≥ I thought due to privacy it was deleting instantly. Really loving the idea my searching is not being tracked, so far all good until proven otherwise. üòä

Please fix the 'App tracking Protection Scanning for tracking activity...beep...boop' notification so you can clear it off the home screen with the 'clear all' on pixel android 12. This started happening 3 updates ago. All notifications from other apps or the OS can be cleared that way, but not this app. Notification settings don't help.

Very unhappy with search engine results. No different than any other. Left wing pol sites and weird matches always on top two pages. No variety of opinion. Paid ad sites on top as well. No way to block specific websites that I don't want to appear on searches. Good blocking and like the burn but still some issues.

Very little to complain about. It does the basics as well as any other browser, in fact I've left Firefox mobile behind since using DuckDuckGo for the past 6 months and I appreciate that nearly all privacy settings are on by default. One feature I do miss however from Brave, Firefox and Vivaldi and that's background video play. If this could be implemented it'd be almost perfect.

It's a great App. I keep as default browser, stops getting my phone bogged down with cookies. Optional virtual VPN is a great idea. BUT it prevented streaming music / radio shortly after the phone went dark. No idea what had been causing the issue and it was driving me nuts. Found out by pure chance. Anyway, that system needs to be sorted to allow the user toggle apps for background web access.

Everything is perfect but I hope it can copy and paste text and links since the browser can be set as a default browser which means it can use for school, work, confidential things, personal things, nonsense things, and etc. Also, app tracking protection is disconnecting and causes slow internet connection.

Uncomplicated, Quick & Easy To Use. However, at what cost? Over time, this App has removed some aspects in its settings - of which I am not comfortable. First, you have no means to decide what type of cookies to accept. Second, there is no setting for declining pre-loading - so I don't have a clue what cookies the app is sending or receiving. Third, all reviews I've read concur that this app has little or no defence against malicious attacks. Hmm ... Uninstalled. Firefox Focus for me ! ü§îüí≠

It's a great app and I love it. There's one bug I want to be fixed though, after I use it for a while it will stop letting me search things, when I try to search things all it will say is "no suggestions". It gets really annoying, the only way im able to get it to go back to normal is if I delete and re-download it.
